alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued November 05 at 5:06AM EDT until November 05 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...BRIEF SHALLOW COASTAL FLOODING POSSIBLE AROUND HIGH TIDE THIS MORNING IN DOWNTOWN CHARLESTON... Tide levels in the Charleston Habor could briefly reaching near 7 feet MLLW with high tide this morning. This will likely result in some brief, shallow coastal flooding in some of the normal locations throughout Downtown Charleston, including areas adjacent to Gadsden Creek. Motorists should be alert for saltwater across parts of Fishburne Street and Hagood Avenue. High tide in the Charleston Harbor will occur just after 616 AM. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 05/06 AM 7.0 1.2 1.1 N/A Minor 05/06 PM 6.8 1.0 0.9 N/A None 06/06 AM 7.2 1.4 0.8 N/A Minor 06/06 PM 6.6 0.8 0.7 N/A None 07/07 AM 7.3 1.5 0.8 N/A Minor &&
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.
